metadata.title: CVE-2022-39177 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
BlueZ before 5.59 allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denialof service because malformed and invalid capabilities can be processed inprofiles/audio/avdtp.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.53-0ubuntu3.6
bluez - 5.53-0ubuntu3.6
bluez-cups - 5.53-0ubuntu3.6
bluez-hcidump - 5.53-0ubuntu3.6
bluez-obexd - 5.53-0ubuntu3.6
bluez-tests - 5.53-0ubuntu3.6
libbluetooth3 - 5.53-0ubuntu3.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.53-0ubuntu3.6').
